info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 3:09AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln, northwestern Mecklenburg, Gaston and northern York Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 308 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Gastonia to 4 miles west of York. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Huntersville, York, Rock Hill, Cornelius, Mt Holly, Davidson, Belmont, South Gastonia and Tega Cay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
